channel.title: Hosting my own server [Help]
channel.description:
Well, i was wondering how. I have seen atleast over 20 tutorials on how to, but they never work. Here's a picture of all the things that have to do with it: [img]http://i440.photobucket.com/albums/qq122/Gamingdisciple/helpme.jpg[/img] (I have set port 43594 open through firewall also.) Some questions i have: 1.For linksys portforwarding, should the name be the same as the firewall name? 2.For linksys portforwarding, under ip adress, do i put in my default gateway, ipv4 internet adress, or the adress i use to use to connect to my server through lan?(the one in picture) 3.Could windows vista have anything to do with the hosting problem? 4.When i connect to my server, i connect locally. Do all hosters do that? Or are they able to connect through their hostname(infscape.no-ip.biz) 5.When i go to canyouseeme.org (port check tool) it says: "Error: I could not see your service on Myiphere on port (43594) Reason: Connection timed out" Does this mean: A. I did not set my router/firewall correctly. Or B. I am not hosting it correctly. 6.How can i know for sure i am hosting it without any1 connecting?
If you guys could answer ANY of these questions, PLEASE do. Thanks

item.title: Hosting my own server [Help]
item.dc:creator: @heyman1232 heyman1232
item.description:
@heyman1232 wrote:

Same thing with me, isp blocked 43594[br][br][size=1]Posted on: July 03, 2009, 03:53:57 pm[/size][hr]Listen your ISP provider blocked 43594, so just call up ur isp and tell that packie to unblock it

Read full topic

item.title: Hosting my own server [Help]
item.dc:creator: @da_man1 da man1
item.description:
@da_man1 wrote:

I think I have an answer for 4.
Most hosters (That I know) usually leave the IP feild blank or put “0.0.0.0” or something else. But some people put their IP. If thats what you are asking there u go. If your asking something different let me know.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @legend-scape legend-scape
item.description:
@legend-scape wrote:

OK this is what i did, try deleting ur no-ip and then make a new 1, but dont worry the old no-ip will still work,

hope i hoped :o,

item.title: Hosting my own server [Help]
item.dc:creator: @disciple disciple
item.description:
@disciple wrote:

Well, i was wondering how. I have seen atleast over 20 tutorials on how to, but they never work.
Here’s a picture of all the things that have to do with it:

helpme.jpg770×710

(I have set port 43594 open through firewall also.)
Some questions i have:
1.For linksys portforwarding, should the name be the same as the firewall name?
2.For linksys portforwarding, under ip adress, do i put in my default gateway, ipv4 internet adress, or the adress i use to use to connect to my server through lan?(the one in picture)
3.Could windows vista have anything to do with the hosting problem?
4.When i connect to my server, i connect locally. Do all hosters do that? Or are they able to connect through their hostname(infscape.no-ip.biz)
5.When i go to canyouseeme.org (port check tool) it says: “Error: I could not see your service on Myiphere on port (43594)
Reason: Connection timed out” Does this mean: A. I did not set my router/firewall correctly. Or B. I am not hosting it correctly.
6.How can i know for sure i am hosting it without any1 connecting?

If you guys could answer ANY of these questions, PLEASE do. Thanks
